intro: Palicourea amapaensis, commonly known as the Amapa False Olive, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy berries. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
